problem.markdown:
>>What is the inventory trade-off in the Make to Order production?<<
( ) Large finished goods inventories needed to prevent stockouts, but small finished goods inventories needed to keep cost low. ( ) Space required for storage (x) Excess production capacity is needed to allow early, reliable delivery promises, but minimal production capacity is needed to keep costs low. ( ) Damaged inventory
[Explanation] In order to be able to reliably ship orders on time, manufacturers need to have production capacity readily available. This means workers and production equipment, which are expensive. [Explanation]
